description: 共同科英文（一）課程為一學年課程，每學期兩學分，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 增進學生英語溝通表達能力
透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神
透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野
透過課堂討論培養批判精神
提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
**Freshman English I**

Fall 2020

**INSTRUCTOR**  Ann Wan-Hsin Lee 李婉歆 (annlee@ntnu.edu.tw)

**COURSE DESCRIPTION**

This course is designed to support students in their use of English language in academic context. Through intensive and extended reading of text materials, engagement in production activities, practice at the Self-Learning Center, and intensive online reading, students are expected to acquire communication strategies for reading, listening, speaking, and writing, develop fluency and autonomy, and improve their critical thinking skills.

**Course Objectives**

This course aims to (1) develop students’ four skills in English; (2) improve their knowledge of vocabulary and grammar in English; (3) build their confidence in speaking English; (4) enhance their learning motivation; (5) foster their cultural knowledge and intercultural competence.

**Delivery of instruction**

1.  Lecture
2.  Group discussion & cooperation (Quality Talk)
3.  Student presentation

**Textbook**

Daise, D., Norloff, C., & Carne, P. (2015). _Q: Skills for Success: Reading and Writing, 4._ New York: Oxford University Press.

**Articles**

Unit 1, Reading 1: We All Need a Hero

Unit 2, Reading 1: So Much Dead Space

Unit 3, Reading 1: The Good Teen

Unit 4, Reading 1: Two Styles of Writing

**PRESENTATION: Stances and viewpoints**

In groups of 4, find a discussable/controversial issue related to the topics covered in class. Present your findings and provide questions for classmates to discuss.

**REQUIREMENTS & RULES**

1.  You will be asked to work in pairs and in groups. Please be a responsible partner.
2.  Attendance is important. Please show up on time.
3.  A notification of absence form has to be submitted online (學生請假系統). It is also the students’ own responsibility to catch up with the class after their absence.
4.  Please make sure that you have your Moodle account and check both the course site and your email regularly. Not receiving a notice/an email is NOT an excuse for absence or late submission.
